documents.document:
What's Next for the Top Skateboarder with the Largest Cash

They are the very best there are to offer in http://www.maloofmoneycup.com. Since 2007, the best skilled http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=section&layout=blog&id=13&Itemid=216&lang=en have traveled from all around the world to contend in the Maloof Money Cup for the greatest purse prize in both vert & street skateboarding. In the Vert Competition, some of the pro skaters who have competed have consisted of Pierre-Luc Gagnon, Andy MacDonald, Bucky Lasek & even Olympic Gold Medalist Shaun White. On the street courses, created by skateboarders, some of the most amazing skateboarding in the lifetime of the extreme sport has occured. Once again, the biggest names have taken their turns in the skate jams, together with Ryan Sheckler, 2008 winner Paul Rodriquez, 2011 NY champion Greg Lutzka and Chris Cole. In fact the sport has turn into so aggressive that the competition has proposed http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=239%3Amaloof-offers-1m-skateboarding-bonus&catid=64%3Ageneral-articles-all-locations&Itemid=367&lang=en to any person who can win 4 Maloof Money Cup Main Events. While 3 time champion Chris Cole is in the lead to just take the money, the stakes are significant with combative pros raising the bar & AMs entering the competition, like Scott Decenzo & Rily Hawk. For a pro http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=section&layout=blog&id=13&Itemid=216&lang=en in 2011, it is anyone’s game. I, for one, cannot wait to see what is next.

Maloof Road Tour Headed To Wrap Up Labor Day Weekend in Wash

The http://maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=category&layout=blog&id=105&Itemid=286&lang=en is heading into the closing stops of its cross-state RV tour, with just four metropolitan areas remaining on the twelve-city summer trip that started June eleven in Chicago. The summer season circuit comes to a prevent at the initial-ever Maloof Money Cup contest in Washington D.C. held on Labor Day Weekend. The tour’s final 4 cities are Birmingham, Miami, Atlanta and Philadelphia.

The Maloof Road Tour works with and encourages community skate stores in each town to host skateboarding contests (High Ollie, Game of Skate, Best Line contests and more) on Saturdays at just about every city of the circuit. The winners of the Best Line competitions through Aug. 14 will be taken to Vegas for MAGIC (Aug 22-23), the style industry’s most significant trade show where they will contend on a custom built course on the exhibit flooring for a chance at $5,000 dollars.

“Through the Road Tour, we wanted to promote the local community skate shops,” said Tim McFerran, General Manager of Maloof http://www.maloofmoneycup.com. “They are the lifeblood of the industry and it’s thanks to them and our amazing partners Vans, vitaminwater and Skull Candy for making the tour possible. The most important part of this tour has been the Community Service Sundays that give the skateboarding community the chance to become involved and make a difference. We have had thousands of kids volunteer their time for service projects on tour Sundays. Projects like skate park cleanup, graffiti removal, skate gear drives and riverbed cleanup are often lacking in funding. Having the kids get involved will, we hope, be something that inspires them to become engaged and active members of their communities.”

Final Maloof Road Tour Dates/Towns

· AUG 6-7: Birmingham
· AUG 13-14: Miami
· AUG 20-21: Atlanta, GA
· AUG 27-28: Philadelphia,PA

The Maloof Road Tour headed out June 11 in Chicago and has traveled to Kansas City, Denver, Vegas, Sacramento, Vancouver, Dallas and Salt Lake City. The Maloof Road Tour crew includes Pro http://maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=section&layout=blog&id=13&Itemid=216&lang=en http://www.rodneytorresnyc.com, Dante Yore from NY Skate Store http://www.homagebrooklyn.com, Tour Manager Eric Isenberg and Road Tour Videographer Chris Miller. These men have been fantastic providing up there total summer time to tour the nation advocating skateboarding and each skate shop alongside the way.

New Skate Park Being Built into DC!

By now, I consider most people have noticed how significant a benefit it is to any city to build a http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=category&layout=blog&id=106&Itemid=417&lang=en Despite the fact that skateboarding is an inexpensive sport for the athletes comparative to other sports, the skate parks are wherever the bills arrive. Because of this, a lot of areas are unable to bring a course in. That is why the Maloof Money Cup has grow to be a coveted function to cities all around the planet. Alongside with throwing the remarkable skateboarding championships, the organization partners with Vans to fork up expense for a new skate park for every location they throw an competition. This year, they are up to four competition all-around the globe & the upcoming location is in our nation’s capital, Washington DC!

I’ve never been there, but I’m excited after reading through the plans of the park being built into the RFK Stadium Festival Grounds. One of my all-time favorite pro http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=section&layout=blog&id=13&Itemid=216&lang=en & all around excellent guy Geoff Rowley plays a key position in the design and style of each skate park they assemble & he has this to say:

“It was important for us to take design elements from real DC skate spots and try to replicate them and hopefully complement them as much as possible,” said Rowley. “The local skaters will recognize some of these influences like the Freedom Plaza Ledges and the Golden Rail made famous by legendary locals like Pepe Martinez, Chris Hall and many more original DC rippers,” said Rowley.

The park will be a fifteen thousand square-foot skate park and is the initial significant skate park in Washington, D.C. and is inspired by Freedom Plaza and the architecture up and down Pennsylvania Avenue. Again, California Skateparks will be handling the construction and if it’s anything at all like the other Maloof Skate Parks, it must be top notch.

On Labor Day weekend, I’ll be heading to check out the new park at the 6th Maloof Money Cup http://www.maloofmoneycup.com. I guess there is no better way to break in a new skate park than to watch some of the very best pro skaters like Geoff Rowley, Greg Lutzka, Dennis Busenitz & much more combating for the next $160,000 prize.

Ronnie Creager Wins Maloof Best Line Challenge at MAGIC!

The Finals for the Best Line Competition were held in Las Vegas, NV on the MAGIC tradeshow floor (MAGIC is the largest trend tradeshow in the U.S.) Tuesday afternoon and marked the culmination of the 4-month long Maloof Road Tour which traveled to 12 cities through the States hosting competitions to uncover the greatest young http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=section&layout=blog&id=13&Itemid=216&lang=en.

Closing Outcomes:
1st Ronnie Creager -- $10,000
2nd Morgan Smith -- $5,000
3rd Kurtis Colamonico -- $2500

Creager's successful line integrated a smith grind 270 out, a switchtail 270 out to a switchcrook half-cab flipout. Creager is a 20-year veteran from Orange County, CA known for his technical skateboarding, as well as his humility and friendliness.

Held at the Mandalay Bay Convention Center as part of the new Ride Unltd. extreme sports activities initiative at MAGIC, the trend industry’s biggest tradeshow Maloof Skateboarding and MAGIC brought in http://www.maloofmoneycup.com retailers from around the United States to show up at the exhibit.

"When we started operating with MAGIC, our goal was to make MAGIC a skateboarding industry destination again. We've seen a large expansion in skateboarding industry involvement and we're very excited as we appearance to the long term of this partnership," explained Tim McFerran, GM of Maloof Money Cup, the Greatest http://www.maloofmoneycup.com

The Last Leg of “Skateboarding for Hope” Professional To

Professional Tour Commences September eighteen in Johannesburg then ventures to Cape Town, Durban and Kimberley, Leading up to Maloof Money Cup World http://www.maloofmoneycup.com.

Maloof Skateboarding announced the last leg of its Pro expedition will start September eighteen in Johannesburg, South Africa. The tour stars Fallen team skaters Billy Marks, Tommy Sandoval, Slash (Brian Hansen), Garrett Hill, Jack Curtin, Tom Asta, Anthony Schultz and James Hardy.

Skate enthusiasts will take pleasure in live skateboarding demonstrations, street skateboarding with pro U.S. skateboarders and meet and greets through the series of destinations.

The Fallen Pro Tour is a component of the “Skateboarding for Hope,” a ten-month venture and outreach program across the Provinces of South Africa, which was set up to promote skateboarding as a positive, energetic way of living for youth, contribute to training and develop healthful communities.

With the assistance of the Northern Cape Province as one of its company governance initiatives, the Maloof Money Cup will perform an important purpose in positioning the province as the premier action sports activities spot in the state. According to CEO of Northern Cape Tourism Authority Sharron Lewis, the function will also help youth development, skills transfer, career development and have a substantial economic influence on community communities.

FALLEN Professional TOUR Timeline of Activities
Sunday, Sept. eighteen at twelve p.m., JOHANNESBURG: Skate Park demonstration at Revolution Festival Mall
Friday, Sept. 23 at 4 p.m., DURBAN: Skate Park demonstration at Revolution Pavilion Demo
Sat, Sept. 24 at two p.m., TOKAI/CAPE City: Mini Ramp Demo at Sports
Unrestricted
Sun, Sept twenty five at 12 p.m., STELLENBOSCH, Skate Park Demo at The Shed

Nearby http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=section&layout=blog&id=13&Itemid=216&lang=en can win a position in the South Africa am qualifiers by competing in 1 of 3 forthcoming “Best Trick Skate Jams” at the public qualifier events detailed under.

Public Qualifier Events
Sunday, September eighteen at ten a.m., JOHANNESBURG: Revolution Festival Mall
Friday, September 23 at 2pm, DURBAN: Revolution Pavilion
Sunday, September 25 at 12 p.m., STELLENBOSCH: The Shed

Picture and video entries will also be accepted. Enter by posting on the http://www.facebook.com/maloofmoneycup wall.

Andrew Reynolds Professional Skateboarder

<IMG SRC="http://maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/images/photos/62/115/thumb_e4471c7da259f50c0ed47da4.jpg"; ALT="Andrew Reynolds Skateboarding" style="margin: 10px; float: right;]If you're conversing living <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com]skate</A> legends, you're speaking of <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=1593%3Aandrew-reynolds&catid=91&Itemid=293&lang=en]Andrew Reynolds</A>, who's been 1 of the ideal identified and most revered <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=section&layout=blog&id=13&Itemid=216&lang=en]skaters</A> in the world sincethe early 90s. Reynolds is a single of the greatest technical shredders in the world, with untouchable precision and the skill to slaughter even the most crazy attributes, like heelflipping and frontside flipping down a 17 stair. The founder of Baker Skateboards and imaginative director of Altamont Apparel, Reynolds has generated some traditional video clip elements in Emerica's This is Skateboarding and Baker's Baker 3 and Baker Has a Deathwish. Reynolds is a prolific video game rider, with cameos in the original Tony Hawk's Pro Skater, Pro Skater 2-4 and Skate 3 amid others. He could not be a large enthusiast of skate competitions, but when he does skate in them, you're not looking anyplace else. Most not long ago Reynolds dropped a before long-to-be legendary component in Emerica's Stay Gold - amongst his own vocation and the insane workforce he's put collectively on Baker, Reynolds is bound to be a single of the inspiring bros in all places to step on a board for a long time to come.

Professional Skateboarder Geoffrey Rowley

<IMG SRC="http://maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/images/photos/62/100/thumb_24090323f668fb69bea2ef68.jpg"; ALT="Skateboarder Goeff Rowley" style="margin: 10px; float: left;]Geoffrey Rowley born June six, 1976, in Liverpool, England is a pro <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=section&layout=blog&id=13&Itemid=216&lang=en]skateboarder</A>.

<A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=1643%3Ageoff-rowley&catid=91%3Astreet-pro-riders&Itemid=293&lang=en]Geoff Rowley</A> began <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com]skateboarding</A> at the age of thirteen, and was initially sponsored by Flip Skateboards when it was based mostly in the United Kingdom beneath the name Deathbox ahead of the shift to California and is an original crew member.

He at present resides in Huntington Beach.

Eli Reed Professional Skateboarder

<IMG SRC="http://maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/images/photos/62/112/thumb_609f12da27761692207016cb.jpg"; ALT="Eli Reed Skateboarder" style="margin: 10px; float: left;]A amazing video <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=section&layout=blog&id=13&Itemid=216&lang=en]skater</A> (just watch Zered Basset's "Vicious Cycle" or Jereme Rogers' "Neighborhood" with crazy tranny capabilities, <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=1637%3Aeli-reed&catid=91%3Astreet-pro-riders&Itemid=293&lang=en]Eli Reed</A> is repping the 617. Born in Boston, this '09 Red Bull Manny Mania champ is <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com]skating</A> greater than ever and developing an undeniable street reputation - peep his FuelTV skateboard tour of Boston.

Pro Skater Adam Dyet

<IMG SRC="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/images/photos/62/112/xthumb_5c196edfd41c66510505a87b.jpg.pagespeed.ic.fFNlkK0gbu.jpg"; style="margin: 10px; float: left;" ALT="Adam Dyet Skateboarding>Huntington Beach is the residence to a ton of fantastic <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=section&layout=blog&id=13&Itemid=216&lang=en]skaters</A>, and <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=1586%3Aadam-dyet&catid=98%3Apast-pro-street-riders&Itemid=304&lang=en]Adam Dyet</A> is no exception. A native of Salt Lake City - a good area to learn to skateboard, according to Adam, thanks to no shortage of areas to <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com]skate</A> - Adam went from rookie to professional in only eight years, and soon after turning professional on March one, 2007, he waited only a few days before profitable his initial professional contest, the Globe Double Stack Cash Attack. He's also won first prize at the Tampa Professional Best Trick Competition and the Tech Deck Best Trick contest at Maloof Money Cup, and though he's great on the program, Dyet is a real street rider who can get even the sickest crash and get back again up for enjoy of the sport.

Professional Skateboarder Sierra Fellers

<IMG SRC="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/images/stories/SierraFellers.jpg"; ALT="Sierra Fellers Skateboarding" style="margin: 10px; float: left;]This Whitefish, Montana born and bred phenom of street <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com]skating</A> initially created a name for himself by tearing up a sequence of Tampa Ams and profitable the competition's Best Trick prize. Because then <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=1719%3Asierra-fellars&catid=91%3Astreet-pro-riders&Itemid=293&lang=en]Sierra Fellers</A> has been showcased in significant <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com]skate</A> publications and some ill video clips, like Foundation's "Cataclysmic Abyss" and C1RCA's "It's Time."

Lizard King Professional Skater

<IMG SRC="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/images/photos/62/112/thumb_a7338bb36c138d4baa568594.jpg"; ALT="Lizard King Skateboarding" style="margin: 10px; float: right;]The <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=section&layout=blog&id=13&Itemid=216&lang=en]skater</A> formerly recognized as Mike Plumb is with no a doubt 1 of the most exceptional dudes you'll ever meet, the two on and off the board. At first from Salt Lake City, the <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=1679%3Alizard-king&catid=91%3Astreet-pro-riders&Itemid=293&lang=en]Lizard King</A>'s insanely sick <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com]skating</A> and just plain insane individuality constantly gets a crowd amped up and even hypes up his rivals. He's virtually in no way observed with out his Green Room team - maintain an eye out for them, mainly because they just might come a-shreddin' to your town!

Professional Skater Greg Lutzka

<A HREF="http://www.Twitter.com/GregLutzka]Gregory Lutzka</A> born April 20, 1985, in Milwaukee, Wisconsin is a professional skateboarder.

<IMG SRC="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/images/photos/62/122/xthumb_fa296804d6c444c06d80301d.jpg.pagespeed.ic.raxB0rHGjs.jpg"; ALT="Greg Lutzka Skateboarding" style="margin: 10px; float: right;]Initially from Beer City USA, he grew up in Milwaukee <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com]skateboarding</A> in which he could skateboard ten to fifteen street spots a day with out the trouble of getting kicked out or substantially traffic. While traveling to a variety of nations he progressed as a professional <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=section&layout=blog&id=13&Itemid=216&lang=en]skateboarder</A>. With the consoling from his mentors and others in the sector he moved to Southern Cali at the age of eighteen to progress further more and adhere to his enthusiasm and career.

Lutzka started off out skating for Beer City Skateboards. Following heading to Tampa he was discovered by Al Partanen. He was then sponsored professionally by Illenium Skateboards. In late 2003, he still left Illenium to trip for Rodney Mullens new skateboard business, Almost Skateboards. He also chills with the Entertainer Lil John each day.

<A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=1646%3Agreg-lutzka&catid=91%3Astreet-pro-riders&Itemid=293&lang=en]Greg Lutzka</A> is a technical skater, who likes to incorporate kick flip combos into his runs that typically appear to hit most every little thing on the park. He is very well identified for his 270 back lipslides and Frontside 360 Kickflips.

Pro Skateboarder Darrell Stanton

<IMG SRC="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/images/stories/riders/Darrell-Stanton.jpg"; ALT="Darrell Stanton Skateboarding" style="margin: 10px; float: left;]Hailing from Houston, TX <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=1625%3Adarrell-stanton&catid=91%3Astreet-pro-riders&Itemid=293&lang=en]Darrell Stanton</A> is a all-natural on the board. With a versatility and lankiness to his entire body almost no single person could recreate if they tried to, his model is completely exclusive. There are several who can make it look great like Darrell does. Gaps, rails, tech, excursions, contests-it does not matter, Darrell is regularly pushing the limits of what can be performed on a <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com]skateboard</A> and executing it with finesse and a smile the entire way. His southern hospitality and helpful persona contribute to his good attitude when competing. Of the endless options of <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=category&layout=blog&id=106&Itemid=417&lang=en]skate parks</A> his favorite spot to shred is the Volcom Skatepark and his beloved trick is the dolphin flip.

Ryan Decenzo Professional Skater

<IMG SRC="http://maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/images/photos/62/101/thumb_0686ca8c63b65fa534a70260.jpg"; ALT="Ryan Decenzo Skateboarding" style="margin: 10px; float: left;]At first from Delta, British Columbia, <A HREF="http://maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_community&view=profile&task=app&userid=1804&app=phototagged&Itemid=60&lang=en]Ryan Decenzo</A> is a <A HREF="http://maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=section&layout=blog&id=13&Itemid=216&lang=en]skateboarder</A> who's known for his impressive street jams - he might not usually just take first at the podium, but he's acquired an undeniable fashion and he goes huge regardless of where by he's <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com]skateboarding</A>, be it in Transworld's Hallelujah or nollieing down El Toro.

Dennis Busenitz Professional Skater

<IMG SRC="http://maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/images/stories/riders/Dennis-Busenitz.jpg"; ALT="Dennis Busenitz Skateboarding" style="margin: 10px; float: right;]Fresh new off the Volcom Brand Jeans Tour, this Volcom team member has more than 15 years of <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com]skateboarding</A> beneath his belt and was titled Transworld's Best Street <A HREF="http://maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=section&layout=blog&id=13&Itemid=216&lang=en]Skateboarder</A> in 2006. Natural talent led this Kansas-born skater to events like Maloof Money Cup and sponsors like Volcom. <A HREF="http://maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=1630%3Adennis-busenitz&catid=91%3Astreet-pro-riders&Itemid=293&lang=en]Dennis Busenitz</A> has also appeared in his very own FuelTV video, which followed Dennis's road trip from Kansas to San Fran and caught him shredding all the skate spots he could come across on the way.

Bastien Salabanzi Pro Skater

<IMG SRC="http://maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/images/stories/Bastien-Salabanzi.jpg.pagespeed.ce.D86I_-o7a0.jpg"; ALT="Bastien Salabanzi Skateboarding" style="margin: 10px; float: right;]<A HREF="http://maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=1598%3Abastien-salabanzi&catid=91&Itemid=293&lang=en]Bastien Salabanzi</A> (born Nov eighteen, '85 in Toulon, France) is a professional <A HREF="http://maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=section&layout=blog&id=13&Itemid=216&lang=en]skater</A>. His stance is regular.

He started off skateboarding when he was nine, and quickly immediately after acquired his initial sponsorship by the Skateshop of Toulon. He came in 1st at his initial competition at the age of 11 in Marseille, France. Following that, Vans brought him to the finals in CA, his very first trip to the United States.

Bastien finished 3rd in the street <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com]skateboarding competition</A> at the '04 X Games.

He won the WSR05 skateboard competition in Rotterdam, Netherlands in 2005 and Mystic Skate Cup in Prague - the well known contest from the World Cup sequence held traditionally in Prague. He came in first also World cup in Dortmund (Globe Shoes World Skateboard Contest) when he was only 16 years old.

Pro Skater Garrett Hill

<IMG SRC="http://maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/images/photos/62/120/xthumb_9d16db4d7361a6b9521e143a.jpg.pagespeed.ic.XV_meDXYRU.jpg"; ALT="Garrett Hill Skateboarding" style="margin: 10px; float: left;]<A HREF="http://maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=article&id=1642%3Agarrett-hill&catid=91%3Astreet-pro-riders&Itemid=293&lang=en]Garrett Hill</A> is a up-&-coming rookie with some really serious tricks up his sleeve. Hailing from Santa Monica, his initially professional competition was the '10 Maloof Cash Cup in New York. His qualifying spherical at the MMC <A HREF="http://www.maloofmoneycup.com]Skateboarding</A> Contest in Costa Mesa, is a glimpse of what you can assume for the duration of the '11 time. Check out professional <A HREF="http://maloofmoneycup.com/skateboarding/index.php?option=com_content&view=section&layout=blog&id=13&Itemid=216&lang=en]skater</A> Garrett shredding it up in Zero?s ?New Blood?.
